title-group.article-title: Toward More Effective Use Of School Resources

p.mixed-citation: Patrick E. Haggerty, "Research and Development, Educational Productivity and the American Economy," Educational Researcher, September 1973, pp. 4-10.
J. A. Kershaw and R. N. McKean, Systems Analysis and Education (Santa Monica, California: The Rand Corporation, 1959), p. 2.
E. W. Martin, Jr., "The Systems Concept," in Systems, Organizations, Analysis, Management: A Book of Readings, ed. David I. Cleland and William R. King (New York: McGraw-Hill, 1969), p. 49.
Frank H. Banghart, Educational Systems Analysis (London: MacMillan, 1969), p. 26.
Van Court Hare, Jr., Systems Analysis: A Diagnostic Approach (New York: Har- court, Brace, and World, 1967), p. 2.

Henry M. Levin, "The Effect of Different Levels of Expenditure on Educational Output," in Economic Factors Affecting the Financing of Education, Vol. 2 (Gainesville, Florida: National Educational Finance Project, 1970), pp. 173-206.
J. Alan Thomas, The Productive School: A Systems Analysis Approach to Edu- cational Administration (New York: John Wiley & Sons, 1971).
Ibid., pp. 79-95.
William G. Spady, "The Impact of School Resources on Students," in Review of Research in Education, I, ed. Fred N. Kerlinger (Itasca, Illinois: F. E. Peacock Pub- lishers, Inc., 1973), pp. 135-77.
Paul R. Mort, Walter C. Reusser, and John W. Polley, Public School Finance (New York: McGraw-Hill, 1960), pp. 77-215.
James S. Coleman, Equality of Educational Opportunity (Washington, D. C: U. S. Department of Health, Education and Welfare, 1966).
Samuel S. Bowles and Henry Levin, "The Determinants of Scholastic Achieve- ment-An Appraisal of Some Recent Evidence," Journal of Human Resources, Summer 1968, pp. 3-24.
Eric A. Hanushek, "The Education of Blacks and Whites" (Ph.D. diss., Massa- chusetts Institute of Technology, 1968).
Martin T. Katzman, "Distribution and Production in a Big City Elementary School System," Yale Economic Essays, Spring 1968, pp. 201-56.
Bowles, "Toward an Educational Production Function."
Henry M. Levin, "A New Model of School Effectiveness," in Do Teachers Make a Difference? (Washington, D. C; U. S. Department of Health, Education, and Welfare, 1970), pp. 55-78.
Daniel F. Luecke and Noel F. McGinn, "Regression Analyses and Education Production Functions: Can They Be Trusted?" Harvard Educational Review, August 1975, pp. 325-50.

Anita A. Summers and Barbara L. Wolfe, "Which School Resources Help Learning? Efficiency and Equity in Philadelphia Public Schools," Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia Business Review, February 1975.
Richard J. Murnane, The Impact of School Resources on the Learning of Inner City Children (Cambridge, Massachusetts: Ballinger Publishing Co., 1975).
